verses.kjv: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, eat that thou findest; eat this roll, and go speak unto the house of Israel.
verses.ct: Then he told me, "Son of man, eat what is in front of you. Eat this scroll, and then go speak to the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat that roll.
verses.ct: So I opened my mouth, and he fed me the scroll.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat, and fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then did I eat it; and it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Son of man, fill your stomach — consume this scroll that I'm giving you." So I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.
verses.ct: Then he told me, "Son of man, go now to the people of Israel and deliver my words to them."

verses.kjv: For thou art not sent to a people of a strange speech and of an hard language, but to the house of Israel;
verses.ct: "You are not being sent to a foreign people who speak a strange and difficult language, but to the people of Israel —

verses.kjv: Not to many people of a strange speech and of an hard language, whose words thou canst not understand. Surely, had I sent thee to them, they would have hearkened unto thee.
verses.ct: not to many nations with unfamiliar and hard-to-understand languages. If I had actually sent you to those people, they would have listened to you.

verses.kjv: But the house of Israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will not hearken unto me: for all the house of Israel are impudent and hardhearted.
verses.ct: But the people of Israel will refuse to listen to you, because they refuse to listen to me. The entire nation of Israel is stubborn and hard-hearted.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have made thy face strong against their faces, and thy forehead strong against their foreheads.
verses.ct: Look — I have made you just as tough as they are, and your determination just as strong as theirs.

verses.kjv: As an adamant harder than flint have I made thy forehead: fear them not, neither be dismayed at their looks, though they be a rebellious house.
verses.ct: I have made your resolve harder than diamond, harder than flint. Don't be afraid of them, and don't be intimidated by the way they look at you, even though they are a rebellious people."

verses.kjv: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.
verses.ct: He also told me, "Son of man, take in every word I speak to you. Absorb them deep in your heart and listen carefully.

verses.kjv: And go, get thee to them of the captivity, unto the children of thy people, and speak unto them, and tell them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.
verses.ct: Then go to the exiles — your own people — and speak to them. Tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says,' whether they choose to listen or refuse."

verses.kjv: Then the spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing, saying, Blessed be the glory of the LORD from his place.
verses.ct: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me a loud rushing sound, saying, "Blessed is the glory of the LORD from his place."

verses.kjv: I heard also the noise of the wings of the living creatures that touched one another, and the noise of the wheels over against them, and a noise of a great rushing.
verses.ct: I also heard the sound of the living creatures' wings brushing against each other, the rumbling of the wheels beside them, and a tremendous roaring noise.

verses.kjv: So the spirit lifted me up, and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.
verses.ct: The Spirit lifted me up and carried me away. I went feeling bitter and deeply agitated in my spirit, but the LORD's hand was powerfully on me.

verses.kjv: Then I came to them of the captivity at Telabib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days.
verses.ct: I arrived at Tel Abib, where the exiles lived by the Chebar River. I sat among them right where they were staying, and I remained there in a state of shock for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: After those 7 days had passed, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, I have made thee a watchman unto the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me.
verses.ct: "Son of man, I have appointed you as a watchman for the people of Israel. Whenever you hear a message from me, you must warn them on my behalf.

verses.kjv: When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; and thou givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thine hand.
verses.ct: If I tell a wicked person, 'You are going to die,' and you fail to warn them or speak up to turn them from their evil ways in order to save their life, that wicked person will die because of their sin — but I will hold you responsible for their death.

verses.kjv: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.
verses.ct: However, if you do warn the wicked person and they still refuse to turn from their wickedness and evil ways, they will die because of their sin, but you will have saved your own soul.

verses.kjv: Again, When a righteous man doth turn from his righteousness, and commit iniquity, and I lay a stumbling-block before him, he shall die: because thou hast not given him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he hath done shall not be remembered; but his blood will I require at thine hand.
verses.ct: Similarly, if a righteous person turns away from their righteousness and commits sin, and I place an obstacle in their path, they will die. If you did not warn them, they will die in their sin, and the righteous things they once did will not be remembered — but I will hold you responsible for their death.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless if thou warn the righteous man, that the righteous sin not, and he doth not sin, he shall surely live, because he is warned; also thou hast delivered thy soul.
verses.ct: On the other hand, if you warn the righteous person not to sin, and they do not sin, they will certainly live because they accepted the warning — and you will have saved your own soul."

verses.kjv: And the hand of the LORD was there upon me; and he said unto me, Arise, go forth into the plain, and I will there talk with thee.
verses.ct: The LORD's hand came on me there, and he said to me, "Get up and go out to the valley, and I will speak with you there."

verses.kjv: Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of the LORD stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river of Chebar: and I fell on my face.
verses.ct: So I got up and went out to the valley, and the glory of the LORD was standing there — just like the glory I had seen by the Chebar River. I fell facedown.

verses.kjv: Then the spirit entered into me, and set me upon my feet, and spake with me, and said unto me, Go, shut thyself within thine house.
verses.ct: Then the Spirit entered me and raised me to my feet. He spoke to me and said, "Go and shut yourself inside your house.

verses.kjv: But thou, O son of man, behold, they shall put bands upon thee, and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:
verses.ct: As for you, son of man — they will tie you up with ropes and bind you so that you cannot go out among the people.

verses.kjv: And I will make thy tongue cleave to the roof of thy mouth, that thou shalt be dumb, and shalt not be to them a reprover: for they are a rebellious house.
verses.ct: I will make your tongue stick to the roof of your mouth so that you will be silent and unable to correct them, because they are a rebellious people.

verses.kjv: But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth, and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious house.
verses.ct: But when I speak to you, I will open your mouth, and you will tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says.' Whoever is willing to listen, let them listen; and whoever refuses, let them refuse — because they are a rebellious people."
